intro: Perideridia bolanderi, commonly known as Bolander's biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its root system is fibrous and has been historically used by indigenous peoples for medicinal purposes. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
